oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Country Music Hall of Fame Medallion Ceremony - 2008-06-29 - Tom T. Hall, The Statler Brothers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Country Music Hall of Fame medallion ceremony held on June 29, 2008 at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum's Ford Theater. Inductees that year were Ernest V. "Pop" Stoneman, Emmylou Harris, Tom T, Hall and the Statler Brothers. This recording only contains Tom T. Hall and the Statler Brothers segments.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Vince Gill; Amy Grant; The Jordanaires; Michelle Nixon; Bobby Bare; Heather Berry; Tony Mabe; Tom T. Hall; Reba McEntire; Dailey and Vincent; Grandstaff; The Statler Brothers
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Welcome by Kyle Young -- Comments from Steve Turner -- "Rock of Ages" Amy Grant with Vince Gill and The Jordanaires -- Comments from Tammy Genovese -- "Harper Valley USA" Michelle Nixon -- "That's How I Got To Memphis" Bobby Bare -- "Can You Hear Me Now" Heather Berry and Tony Mabe -- Ralph Emery comments and presentation of medallion to Tom T. Hall -- Tom T. Hall comments -- "Old Dogs, Children And Watermelon Wine" Tom T. Hall -- Reba McEntire comments -- "Flowers On The Wall" Reba McEntire -- "Do You Know You Are My Sunshine" Dailey & Vincent (Jamie Dailey and Darrin Vincent) -- "The Statler Brothers Song" Grandstaff (Wil and Langdon Reid) -- Brenda Lee comments and presentation of medallion to the Statler Brothers - Shannon DeWitt comments -- Statler Brothers comments -- "I'll Go To My Grave Loving You" The Statler Brothers -- "Will The Circle Be Unbroken" assembled Hall of Fame members
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.); Hall, Tom T.; Gill, Vince; Grant, Amy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Nixon, Michelle; Bare, Bobby; Berry, Heather; Mabe, Tony; Dailey & Vincent (musical group); Grandstaff (Musical group); Statler Brothers (musical group);
